Premise: If it rains then the road will be wet.
If the road will be wet, there will be a traffic congestion.
Hypothesis: Therefore, if it rains, then there will be a traffic congestion.
Label: True

Premise: If you work hard, you will get a job you like.
If you get a job you like, you will be happy.
Hypothesis: Therefore, if you work hard, you will be happy.
Label: True

Premise: If it is snowing, the train will arrive late.
If the train arrives late, John will not be on time to work.
Hypothesis: Therefore, if it is snowing, john will be early to work.
Label: False

Premise: If you have a sweet tooth, you eat ice cream.
If you eat ice cream, risks of health complications are higher.
Hypothesis: If you have a sweet tooth, risk of health complications are lesser.
Label: False

Premise: If you run long distances, you have a strong metabolism.
If you have a strong metabolism, you will live longer.
Hypothesis: If you run long distances, you will feel thirsty.
Label: Undetermined
